headline: Dramatic schizont-specific upregulation with >400-fold cyclical expression changes during intraerythrocytic development
one_paragraph_summary: This gene exhibits one of the most dramatic expression patterns in Plasmodium falciparum, showing consistent schizont-specific upregulation with expression levels reaching 400-850 TPM during late asexual blood stages compared to <5 TPM during ring and trophozoite stages. The gene displays highly cyclical expression with >400-1000-fold dynamic range throughout the 48-hour intraerythrocytic development cycle, peaking at 38-44 hours post-invasion across multiple independent studies. This expression pattern is conserved across different parasite strains and shows biphasic peaks during early invasion and late schizont stages in some experiments. The dramatic late-stage upregulation and consistent high percentile rankings (>95th percentile) during schizont stages strongly suggest this gene plays a critical role in merozoite formation, egress preparation, or DNA replication processes essential for parasite multiplication.

topics.headline: Consistent schizont-specific upregulation across multiple independent time course studies
topics.one_sentence_summary: Multiple high-resolution transcriptomic studies consistently demonstrate dramatic upregulation of this gene during schizont stages (38-44 hours post-invasion) with >400-fold increases from baseline expression levels.

topics.headline: Strong stage-specific expression maintained across parasite strains and genetic backgrounds
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows consistent schizont-stage upregulation across different P. falciparum strains (3D7, HB3, IT, Dd2) and is maintained in genetic knockout backgrounds, indicating robust developmental regulation independent of strain-specific factors.

topics.headline: Biphasic expression pattern with peaks during invasion and late schizont development
topics.one_sentence_summary: Several studies reveal a biphasic expression pattern with high expression during early invasion (0-8 hours) and dramatic upregulation during late schizont stages (32-48 hours), suggesting dual roles in parasite invasion and egress processes.

topics.headline: Elevated expression in sexual commitment and specialized parasite stages
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows upregulation in sexually committed schizonts compared to asexually committed schizonts and exhibits high expression in ookinetes, suggesting additional roles beyond asexual blood stage development.
